item.title: Musing
item.description: üçµ May 27, 2020 “Because it’s the thought of Mecca that keeps me alive. That’s what helps me face these days that are all the same, these mute crystals on the shelves, and lunch and dinner at that same horrible cafe. I’m afraid that if my dream is realized, I’ll have no reason to go on living.” ‚Äî Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist üçµ May 4, 2020

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m currently a Software Engineer at Zalo working as a backend engineer. I studied Computer Science at the Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology. I was always interested in how things work under the hood. Feel free to drop me a message if you want to know more about me. üòú Personal I love making new friends with people around the world; photography üì∑; reading books üìö; listening to instrumental music üéπ.

item.title: How I wrote a python wrapper for Java implementation of VnCoreNLP
item.description: When working on my thesis, I have to experiment on different tokenize tool. One of those is VnCoreNLP which is reported to have very high accuracy. The thing is it’s written in Java while my pipeline is written in Python. So, I decided to write a python wrapper for it. Let’s go. FYI: If you don’t know it yet, the problem of calling others programming language is interoperability. For example, Java can call native function written in C/C++ using JNI.
